Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Lakers lost to the Cleveland Cavaliers, with the Cavs winning an eighth straight win.
The Milwaukee Bucks came back from 19 points adrift to win 120-112 over the Indiana Pacers.
The Oklahoma City Thunder won their 12th straight game with a 113-105 victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves.
Miscellaneous Highlights: LeBron James became the first person in NBA history to play as a teenager and past the age of 40.
The Los Angeles Lakers are seventh in the West, while the Cleveland Cavaliers are top of the Eastern Conference.
The Oklahoma City Thunder remain top of the Western Conference after their 12th straight win.
Others: LeBron James scored 23 points in the loss to the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Giannis Antetokounmpo finished with 30 points, 12 rebounds, five assists and two steals in the Milwaukee Bucks' comeback win.
